document_data.name: ''The Long and Deadly Dance''
document_data.author: [[Marlarra]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''The Long and Deadly Dance''''' was a ballad penned by [[Marlarra]], the Kissing [[Minstrel]], in the very beginning of the 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{quote|Masked, all our lies we spend as changing winds of fortune blow
The trick that fails many in the end is in time enough coming to know
Who is staunch, trustworthy friend—and who, behind smiles, is foe.|Excerpt from ''The Long and Deadly Dance''}}
document_data.History: ''The Long and Deadly Dance'' was first performed in the {{YearlinkName|1400}}.
